elements.content: Reversible solid-state structural conversion between a three-dimensional network and a one-dimensional chain of Cu(II) triazole coordination polymers in acidic/basic-suspensions or vapors†IIpolymers Tetsuya Yamada Goro Maruta and Sadamu Takeda IIpolymerspolymers12polymerspolymerswater1,2,4-triazoleligands1,2,4-Triazoleligand3,4ligandligandtriazoleligand4,56Possible coordination modes of 1,2,4-triazole at high and low pH conditions.1,2,4-triazole1,2,4-triazoleH2Otetramethoxysilanewater1,2,4-TriazolewaterwaterX-ray structure determinationElemental analysisIR spectrasingle-crystal X-ray diffractionelemental analysisTG-DTAPhotondiffractometergraphitesynchrotronsingle-crystal X-ray diffractionIInitrogen atoms7waterwaterwaterTGDTAnitrogen atomsFramework of seven building blocks of [Cu3(trz)3(μ3-OH)]. Each copper triangular unit is connected to six adjacent units by Cu–N bonding with a dihedral angle of +(−)70.5°. H atoms and part of the triazolate were omitted for simplicity. Color: red, O; orange, Cu; blue, N; gray, C.

elements.content: waterpowder X-ray diffractionPXRDelemental analysishalogenmixingelemental analysishalogenPXRD8PXRD patternRelative composition of each element to 3N of trz for successively converted powder specimens from 1, G1–G15 plotted as a function of pH of HCl/Na2CO3 solution. Powder X-ray diffraction pattern of specimens after successive conversions. (a and f) were calculated for 1 and [CuCl2(H-trz)] (3) from single-crystal data, respectively.8 (b–d) correspond to G1, G8, G15 derived from 1 in the 1st series of successive conversions with decreasing pH as shown in Fig. 2, (e) was observed for the 2nd series of conversion with increasing pH after the 1st series, and (f) was observed for the 3rd series of conversion with decreasing pH after the 1st and 2nd series. The color of the diffraction pattern almost corresponds to the sample color. Cu-Kα irradiation (λ = 1.5444 Å) was used for PXRD at 25 °C.

PXRD pattern

Relative composition of each element to 3N of trz for successively converted powder specimens from 1, G1-G15 plotted as a function of pH of HCl/Na2CO3 solution.

 Powder X-ray diffraction pattern of specimens after successive conversions. (a and f) were calculated for 1 and [CuCl2(H-trz)] (3) from single-crystal data, respectively.8 (b-d) correspond to G1, G8, G15 derived from 1 in the 1st series of successive conversions with decreasing pH as shown in Fig. 2, (e) was observed for the 2nd series of conversion with increasing pH after the 1st series, and (f) was observed for the 3rd series of conversion with decreasing pH after the 1st and 2nd series. The color of the diffraction pattern almost corresponds to the sample color. Cu-Kα irradiation (λ = 1.5444 Å) was used for PXRD at 25 °C.

elements.content: TG-DTAX-ray crystallographic datacrystallographic data‡ Elemental analysis (%) calcd for 1: C 12.20, H 3.24 N 21.33, Cl 12.00; Found: C 12.31, H 2.98, N 21.58, Cl 12.08. Calcd for 2: C 10.60, H 2.82, N 18.55, Br 23.51; Found: C 10.93, H 2.45, N 18.49, Br (24). IR spectra of 1 and 2 were recorded for KBr pellets. 1: (cm−1): 3356(w), 3140(s), 2097(w), 1767(s), 1513(m), 1295(m), 1206(s), 1172(m), 1100(m), 1038(m), 1002(s), 888(w), 668(m). 2: IR (cm−1): 3371(w), 3134(s),2067(w), 1514(m), 1295(m), 1207(s),1173(m), 1173(m), 1101(m), 1002(s), 886(w), 666(m).

IR spectraIR§ Absorption corrections were made. The structure was solved by a direct method (SAPI91) and refined by least-squares methods on F2 using the Crystal Structure program package.9 In these analyses, H atom, six H2O and Cl or Br atoms were not refined because of the small cross section of H atom and disorder. Crystal data for 1: Cu3C6N9H19Cl2; M = 590.82; cubic, a = 24.743(4), V = 15148(4) Å3, T = 140 K, space group Fdc (no. 228), Z = 32, 31859 reflections measured, 31859 unique (Rint = 0.0354) which were used in refinement. The final wR(F2) was 0.0688 (all data). Crystal data for 2: Cu3C6N9H19Br4; M = 679.72; cubic, a = 24.719(8), V = 15104(8) Å3, T = 26 K, space group Fdc (no. 228), Z = 32, 19123 reflections measured, 15228 unique (Rint = 0.0400) which were used in refinement. The final wR(F2) was 0.1415 (all data.)
elements.clean_text:
IR spectra

IR

§ Absorption corrections were made. The structure was solved by a direct method (SAPI91) and refined by least-squares methods on F2 using the Crystal Structure program package.9 In these analyses, H atom, six H2O and Cl or Br atoms were not refined because of the small cross section of H atom and disorder. Crystal data for 1: Cu3C6N9H19Cl2; M = 590.82; cubic, a = 24.743(4), V = 15148(4) Å3, T = 140 K, space group Fdc (no. 228), Z = 32, 31859 reflections measured, 31859 unique (Rint = 0.0354) which were used in refinement. The final wR(F2) was 0.0688 (all data). Crystal data for 2: Cu3C6N9H19Br4; M = 679.72; cubic, a = 24.719(8), V = 15104(8) Å3, T = 26 K, space group Fdc (no. 228), Z = 32, 19123 reflections measured, 15228 unique (Rint = 0.0400) which were used in refinement. The final wR(F2) was 0.1415 (all data.)

elements.content: 9H2OCrystal dataCrystal data¶ The compositional formulae of 4 and 5 were determined by elemental analysis. Calcd for 4: C 13.29, H 1.67, N 23.25, Br 44.21; Found: C 13.23, H 1.72, N 23.04, Br (47). Calcd for 5: C 8.21, H 1.03, N 14.37, Br 54.65; Found: C 8.43, H 1.15, N 14.63, Br (60). Br percentage has less accuracy because of a limit of ion-chromatography under coexistence of Cu ion. Their colors correspond to the two-step color change of a family of 2 described in the text.10

¶ The compositional formulae of 4 and 5 were determined by elemental analysis. Calcd for 4: C 13.29, H 1.67, N 23.25, Br 44.21; Found: C 13.23, H 1.72, N 23.04, Br (47). Calcd for 5: C 8.21, H 1.03, N 14.37, Br 54.65; Found: C 8.43, H 1.15, N 14.63, Br (60). Br percentage has less accuracy because of a limit of ion-chromatography under coexistence of Cu ion. Their colors correspond to the two-step color change of a family of 2 described in the text.10

cln_elements.content: Fig. 3 Powder X-ray diffraction pattern of specimens after successive conversions. (a and f) were calculated for 1 and [CuCl2(H-trz)] (3) from single-crystal data, respectively.8 (b–d) correspond to G1, G8, G15 derived from 1 in the 1st series of successive conversions with decreasing pH as shown in Fig. 2, (e) was observed for the 2nd series of conversion with increasing pH after the 1st series, and (f) was observed for the 3rd series of conversion with decreasing pH after the 1st and 2nd series. The color of the diffraction pattern almost corresponds to the sample color. Cu-Kα irradiation (λ = 1.5444 Å) was used for PXRD at 25 °C.

The color of the diffraction pattern almost corresponds to the sample color. Cu-Kα irradiation (λ = 1.5444 Å) was used for PXRD at 25 °C.
